Articles.Content:
SM-S Plane part pack contains 39 parts designed around a Ã¢â‚¬Å“stealthÃ¢â‚¬Â look. Command pods, fuselages, engines, rcs, wings, control surfaces, asas, srbs and the list goes on. Compatible with 0.24. Mod Author and all credits to SasquatchM

This package contains ye olde SM-S Plane parts with some tweaking in the config files to make it 0.24 compatible. Also, some parameters are adjusted to make it more real.

Original thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/32347-SM-Aeronautics-Release-Thread

Also, config tweaks are welcome!

Edited July 20, 2014 by lttito
0.24 compatibility update
Was it really necessary to take screenshots in twilight?

Was it really necessary to take screenshots in twilight?

I agree, seeing something on the screenshots would be nice.

Thanks for the revival, this looks awesome! But is it compatible with FAR?

EDIT: It is working great!

Edited April 25, 2014 by numsgil
Answered my question
I guess it defeats the purpose of being stealth if you can see it. Just kidding.
It is difficult to see not impossible, I think that is the point.
I added more pics of pats and some planes I make. I hope this time parts can be seen properly.
I'm not quite understanding how that flat SAS module has reaction wheels inside it...

I'm not quite understanding how that flat SAS module has reaction wheels inside it...

It doesn't have reaction wheels, it's only a SAS module. Only command pods have torque.

Aw, I'm bummed that I can't edit the textures for this mod. Used to use it ages ago, nice to see it back, but I can't deal with .mbm's and .mu's, and it's too much of a pain in the arse to convert them all.

Aw, I'm bummed that I can't edit the textures for this mod. Used to use it ages ago, nice to see it back, but I can't deal with .mbm's and .mu's, and it's too much of a pain in the arse to convert them all.

I have an old PC (2GB ram quadCore) and I use Active Texture Management, and I also use B9, LLL and STX and some other mods and I can play reasonably well (sometimes it's a bit laggy if I have in scene 120+ parts ships. SasquatchM also said me he was planning to redo all models, but he hasn't much time for now.

It doesn't have reaction wheels, it's only a SAS module. Only command pods have torque.

What does it do that the command pod isn't already doing then?

What does it do that the command pod isn't already doing then?

I tried to maintain the original parts as much as possible, so command pod haven't sas. They have torque though. Yo only have to put one sas module to have sas
All the stock command pods have sas on them. Are you thinking of the ASAS which I believe doesn't do anything special anymore?

All the stock command pods have sas on them. Are you thinking of the ASAS which I believe doesn't do anything special anymore?

Yes, (except the external seat), and it's because all commands' configs have MODULE {ModuleSAS} on them. SM Commands, like some of firespitter's, don't have it, so may have torque, but SAS does not work unless you add a sas module.
It is compatible with 0.24, maybe (as request) I'll tweak some prices, but for me are fine.
Downloading to see what I can build with it

Downloading to see what I can build with it

Please, post screenshots

Please, post screenshots

I'm not that much into planes, so I don't think I'll keep it installed in the long term, but I gotta say it's amazing how easy it is to create a nice-looking plane with this pack
This... Needs hotrocket CFG files.
